          Course Title                                          DSC-9: SMART DEVICE COMPUTING
                Credit                                                                      4
     Teaching per Week                                                                  4 Hrs
     Minimum weeks per     15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
              Semester                                                                    NaN
Last Review / Revision                                                                    ---
     Purpose of Course              To introduce the most demanding and developing mobile app
                   NaN             technology. Fundamentals of android open source technology
      Course Objective  1. To make students understand fundamentals of mobile app technology.
                   NaN    2. To make students understand various inbuilt features of android.
                   NaN          3. To make students understand the android design essentials.
                   NaN   4. To make students understand android user interface design basics.
          Pr-requisite        Pre-requisite Fundamentals of web technologies and fundamentals
                   NaN                                                  related to mobile OS.
       Course Out come Students will have knowledge about android which is widely used Mobile
                   NaN    OS and open source technology and its concepts. Various features of
                   NaN      android like Application Design Essentials, User Interface Design
                   NaN  Essentials, Use of Common Android APIs, data storage using SQLite and
                   NaN                                         deploying Android application.
        Course Content                                        Unit-1 :Introduction to Android
                   NaN                                             1.1 Android - Architecture
                   NaN                                     1.2 Android Application Components
                   NaN                            1.3 Android Application Directory Structure
                   NaN                         Unit-2 : Android Application Design Essentials
                   NaN         2.1 Understanding the IDE – Emulator/ AVD, logcat, Gradle, SDK
                   NaN                                        2.2. Android Activity Lifecycle
                   NaN                           2.3 Application Context and Activity Context
                   NaN                      2.4 Android Manifest File and its common settings
                   NaN                                           2.5 Intent and Intent Filter
                   NaN                      Unit-3 : Android User Interface Design Essentials
                   NaN             3.1 UI elements – EditText, TextView, Button, RadioButton,
                   NaN                              CheckBox, Listview, RecyclerView, Spinner
                   NaN                             3.2 Designing User Interfaces with Layouts
                   NaN                                                 3.2.1 Relative Layouts
                   NaN                                                   3.2.2 Linear Layouts
                   NaN                                               3.2.3 Constraint Layouts
                   NaN                             Unit-4 : Programming for different devices
                   NaN                        4.1 Android TV, Android for Car, Android Things
                   NaN                                   4.2 Overview of screen compatibility
                   NaN                                  4.3 Support different pixel densities
                   NaN                                          Unit-5 : Menus and Dialog Box
                   NaN                     5.1 Menus – Context menu, Pop-up menu, Option menu
                   NaN                                 5.2 Toast Message and Alert Dialog box
                   NaN                                      Unit-6 : Using Shared preferences

                                                        Purpose of Course                                                                                                                                                                                            Conceptualize the students with the theoretical concepts of Operating System
                                                         Course Objective Familiarization with different objectives of operating system components like\rprocess management and inter-process communication; Experiments on process\rscheduling and other operating system tasks through simulation/implementation\runder a simulated environment
                                                            Pre-requisite                                                                                                                                                                                                              Fundamentals of Computer Organization and Operating System
                                                          Course Out come     Describe the various components of Operating Systems.\rCase study of Unix operating systems to analyze the different services provided\rby UNIX Operating System\rDesign and implement various system calls and concurrent processes requiring\rsynchronization.

Course Code                                                                     Unnamed: 0
     Course Title                         SEC-3: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and IoT
           Credit                                                                              4
Teaching per Week                                                                          4 Hrs
Minimum weeks per             15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
         Semester                                                                            NaN
    Last Review /                                                                            ---
         Revision                                                                            NaN
Purpose of Course      This course presents the blend of Artificial Intelligence and Internet of
              NaN          Things. Artificial Intelligence spans a wide variety of topics at the
              NaN           forefront of computer science research, including areas like machine
              NaN          learning, planning, computer vision, natural language processing, and
              NaN many others. It is the goal of this course to study Artificial Intelligence in
              NaN     today's environment and to instill an understanding of representations and
              NaN  external constraints with the idea of enabling a student to think creatively.
              NaN                       The subject also extends concepts of Internet of Things.
 Course Objective                                                 The objectives are as follows:
              NaN         1) To give initial exposure of Artificial Intelligence to the students
              NaN                  2) To make student understand AI problems and problem solving
              NaN                                                                       approach
              NaN                   3) To make student learn fundamental AI techniques and their
              NaN                                                                   applications
     Pr-requisite        Students are expected to have understanding of Computerized Information
              NaN                                                                         System
  Course Out come                 After having completed the course the student will be able to:
              NaN        1) describe concepts, methods, and theories of problem solving approach
              NaN                          of AI, solution search, heuristics, game playing etc.
              NaN       2) describe concepts, methods, and theories knowledge representation and
              NaN                                                              reasoning systems
              NaN            3) describe concepts behind various AI task like planning, Decision
              NaN                                                            making and Learning
              NaN       4) describe various Techniques and Application Areas of AI in context of
              NaN                                  Expert Systems, ANN, Machine Learning and NLP
   Course Content                                 Unit 1 Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
              NaN                                                               1.1 Intelligence
              NaN                       1.1.1 Composition of intelligence - Reasoning, Learning,
              NaN                           Problem Solving, Perception, Linguistic Intelligence
              NaN                                                    1.2 Artificial Intelligence
              NaN                                               1.2.1 Philosophy and goals of AI
              NaN                                                       1.2.2 Applications of AI
              NaN                  1.3 AI Agents & Environments –types of agents, ideal rational
              NaN                     agent, structure of intelligent agents, Simple Turing test
              NaN                                            environment, environment properties

Unnamed: 0                                          6.4 Embedded system applications
           NaN                                                Unit 7 Overview of Arduino
           NaN                                               7.1 Introduction to Arduino
           NaN                                                   7.2 Flavours of Arduino
           NaN                                           7.3 Components of Arduino board
           NaN                                      7.4 Arduino Power supply, Breadboard
           NaN                                           Unit 8 Programming with Arduino
           NaN                                        8.1 Installing Arduino Desktop IDE
           NaN              8.2 Installing Board drivers, configuring board type, sketch
           NaN                                     8.3Hardware interfacing & programming
           NaN                                             8.3.1. LED on/off using timer
           NaN                                               8.3.2. Working with sensors
           NaN                                   8.3.3. Arduino Traffic Light Controller

           NaN                                      McGrawHill, ISBN : 978-1-25-902998-1

           NaN                                  Patterson, PHI, ISBN : 978-93-325-5194-7

           NaN          Solving (4th Edition 2004) by George F. Luger, Pearson Education

           NaN             Janakiraman, K. Sarukesi, P. Gopalakrishnan, Mc Millan (2002)
           NaN      6. Artificial Intelligence: The Basics (Paperback) by Kevin Warwick,
           NaN                                                     Publisher: Routledge;
           NaN    7. The Essence of Artificial Intelligence (Paperback) by Alison Cawsey
           NaN                                                  Publisher: Prentice Hall
           NaN         8.“Artificial Intelligence” -By Elaine Rich And Kevin Knight (2nd
           NaN                                                 Edition) Tata Mcgraw Hill

          Course Title                                                                     NaN                                           Computer Graphics and animation
                Credit                                                                     NaN                                                                         2
     Teaching per Week                                                                     NaN                                                                     2 Hrs
     Minimum weeks per                                                                     NaN        15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
              Semester                                                                     NaN                                                                       NaN
Last Review / Revision                                                                     NaN                                                                         -
     Purpose of Course                                                                     NaN To train the students to acquire skills in generating marketable computer
                   NaN                                                                     NaN                                           graphics and animated pictures,
      Course Objective                                                                             To understand the concept of computer graphics and Skills in Graphic
                   NaN                                                                     NaN                                                                 Designing
                   NaN                                                                                                          To understand the animation techniques.
         Pre-requisite                                                                     NaN                                                                      ----
       Course Out come   Students are able to understand the concept of graphics and animation                                                                       NaN
                   NaN               effect and image manipulation after completion of course.                                                                       NaN
   Course Description:     Computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use                                                                       NaN
                   NaN      of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation.                                                                       NaN
                   NaN     Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though                                                                       NaN
                   NaN 2D computer graphics are still widely used for low bandwidth and faster                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                              real-time rendering needs.                                                                       NaN
        Course Content                                                                     NaN                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                               Unit 1: Introduction to computer graphics                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                        1.1.Definition computer graphics                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                              1.2.Pixel and Frame Buffer                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                      1.3.Raster and Random Scan display                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                   1.4.Applications of Computer Graphics                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                  1.5.Aliasing and anti aliasing methods                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                               Unit 2: 2D transformation                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                        2.1 2-Dimensional transformation                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                  2.2. Translation, Rotation, Scaling, Reflection, Shear                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                 2.3. Matrix representation and Homogeneous Coordinates.                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                           2.4. Composite transformation                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                                      Unit 3: 2D viewing                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                3.1 Introduction to window and view port                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                                    3.2 Viewing pipeline                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                  3.3 Viewing coordinate reference frame                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                       3.4 Window to view port coordinate transformation                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                                 3.5 Clipping operations                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                                     Unit 4: 3D Concepts                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                   4.1 Three dimensional display methods                                                                       NaN
                   NaN                                                                     NaN        4.1.1 Parallel and perspective projections, Depth Queuing ,Visible
                   NaN                                                                     NaN         line and surface identification ,Surface rendering, Exploaded and
                   NaN                                                                     NaN                     cutways views, three dimension and stereoscopic views

Unnamed: 0                                         Unit 5: Visible surface Detections
                 NaN                                                   5.1. Back face detection
                 NaN                                                   5.2. Depth buffer method
                 NaN                                                       5.3.Scan-line method
                 NaN                                                     Unit 6: Visual Realism
                 NaN               6.1. Light Sources: types of light sources, effects of light
                 NaN                          6.2. Illumination, Shading, Transparency, Shadow,
                 NaN                                     6.3. Colors: model and changes setting
                 NaN                                                          Unit 7: Animation
                 NaN                                7.1. Basic Principles of computer animation
                 NaN                                                    7.2. Types of animation
                 NaN    7.3. Animation methods -Principles, keyframe, Frame by frame animation,
                 NaN         masks, motion, dynamic, behavior, Working in the timeline, Working
                 NaN                     with symbols, Shape tween, staggering animation effect
                 NaN                                                              7.4. Morphing
                 NaN                                         7.5. Animation tools for 2D and 3D
                 NaN                             7.6. Graphics File formats for 2D and 3D image
                 NaN                                           Unit 8: Digital Image Processing
                 NaN                                                8.1. Defining Digital Image
                 NaN                                     8.2. Step for digital image processing
                 NaN                          8.3. basic concept of image processing techniques

                 NaN                4. Computer Graphics By- Rajesh Maurya – Wiley Publications

          Course Title                                               DSE-5: Cloud Computing
                Credit                                                                    2
     Teaching per Week                                                                2 Hrs
     Minimum weeks per   15 (Including Class work, examination, preparation, holidays etc.)
              Semester                                                                  NaN
Last Review / Revision                                                                  ---
     Purpose of Course The course gives students an idea about Cloud Computing fundamentals
                   NaN                                             and Cloud Based Systems.
      Course Objective    To provide comprehensive knowledge of cloud computing and aspects
                   NaN                                                       related to it.
         Pre-requisite         Basic understanding of operating system and computer network
       Course Out come After completion of this course, the student will gain comprehensive
                   NaN           knowledge of Cloud based systems and aspects related to it
        Course Content                               Unit 1 Introduction to Cloud Computing
